Package remodel.io

Class ModelScanner

java.lang.Object
remodel.io.ModelScanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, TokenCodes
public class ModelScanner
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, TokenCodes
ModelScanner is a tokenizer to support parsing ReMoDeL models, metamodels and transformations. ModelScanner is the scanner used by readers in the ReMoDeL toolset. It scans characters from the underlying input stream and groups these according to its internal token grammar into tokens of different kinds, returning the token code and buffering any associated textual data. The method readToken() returns the next token code; and the method getText() returns any associated buffered data.

ModelScanner implements the Closeable interface, so may be used in try-with-resources blocks to guarantee that the ModelScanner and its underlying input stream is closed. Any scanning errors are reported as a TokenError exception, detailing the unrecognised character and the line number.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • ModelScanner

      public ModelScanner​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates a ModelScanner reading from a file, using the default UTF-8 character encoding. Initialises the input to a LineNumberReader, reading from an InputStreamReader with the default encoding, reading from a basic FileInputStream opened on the file. which uses the default UTF-8 character encoding.
      Parameters:
      file - the input file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.

    • ModelScanner

      public ModelScanner​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String encoding) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates a ModelScanner reading from a file, using the specified character encoding. Recognised encodings include UTF-8, UTF-16, ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1) and others, specified as Strings. Creates a LineNumberReader reading from an InputStreamReader with the given encoding, reading from a basic FileInputStream opened on the file.
      Parameters:
      file - the input file.
      encoding - the name of the character encoding.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found or opened.
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the character encoding is not supported.

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes this ModelScanner. Recursively closes the underlying input stream(s).
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.io.Closeable
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if closing fails.

    • getLineNumber

      public int getLineNumber()
      Returns the current line number. Delegates the request to the underlying LineNumberReader input stream. Converts 0..n-1 indexing to 1..n indexing.
      Returns:
      the current line number.

    • getToken

      public int getToken() throws java.io.IOException
      Returns the next token code from the underlying input stream.
      Returns:
      an integer token code.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an input error occurs.

    • getText

      public java.lang.String getText()
      Returns the segmented data corresponding to the last token code. The text buffer is only set if the token warrants storing data; otherwise this buffer is cleared.
      Returns:
      the last buffered text.
